passages.text: Indian Consumer Sector Rey Mgmt. Comments Across 40 terms in 1QFY26

Demand trends continued to show mixed trends across categories. QSR stayed weak, with JUBI, the only outlier (D/D SSS); high- teen growth for food platforms. Momentum continued at Nykaa; premium apparel performed better than value. High gold prices did pose an issue on jewellers but revenue growth benefited. After another modest Qtr, 2Q should see a pickup on festive season. Staple firms expect a gradual recovery in urban even as rural continued to outpace.

Contrast in QSR; steady FD: QSR had another tough qtr with Jubilant Foods the only outlier reporting near- double- digit SSSG. Growth continued to be led by transactions/orders and delivery for most. Commentary on demand was somewhat cautious given the tough macro. Food delivery platforms (Zomato, Swiggy) witnessed a growth rate similar to 4Q at around \(17\%\) YoY (GOV). Both Eternal & Swiggy are hopeful of an improvement in the demand situation in coming quarters on the back of tax cuts and easing of inflation.

Apparel, BPC & footwear: Overall demand remained subdued in 1Q but most management expect the demand environment to improve in FY26 on the back of good monsoon, lower inflation and higher disposable income. Beauty growth was strong for Nykaa, led by customer acquisitions. In apparel, most highlighted that perf. was impacted due to weak discretionary spending; however, the ethnic portfolio did well for ABFRL due to higher wedding days. GoColors reported modest growth with early signs of recovery. Shoppers Stop witnessed premium products growing ahead of overall business and reported positive customer entry growth after many years, though value fashion lagged; however, beauty witnessed growth on back of fragrances and premiumisation. Footwear companies highlighted that demand conditions continued to remain sluggish in 1Q as well.

Paints: In Q1FY26, the paints and adhesives sector saw mixed demand trends. Asian Paints faced subdued demand but witnessed a sequential recovery, while Birla Opus continued to gain market share. Berger Paints reported modest volume growth, led by urban demand and strong performance in construction chemicals. Kansai Norelac saw flat volumes amid competition and regional disruptions but expects better performance in H2. Pidilite delivered over \(10\%\) growth, driven by strong rural and small- town demand, and remains optimistic about sustaining double- digit growth. Overall, companies expect demand to improve in Q2 with festive tailwings.

Jewellery sales growth was healthy in 1Q despite the sharp rise in gold prices. The demand environment remained tough, with weak consumption due to high gold prices and elevated competitive intensity. Titan mentioned that many customers preferred products with low making charges, even at high ticket sizes. Companies such as Kalyan and Senco reported \(30\%\) revenue growth. Q2 is expected to see a higher base effect due to the previous year's customs duty cut and deferment of demand from 1Q to 2Q (in FY25).

Staples: Most companies highlighted a gradual improvement in urban demand while rural continued to outgrow urban. Companies with exposure to summer categories such as beverages, cooling hair oil/prickly heat powder, sunscreen and ice cream were impacted due to unseasonal rains. Volume growth improved sequentially for some players, while realisation growth continued to persist as the industry resorted to product price hikes to pass on the input cost inflation. However, going ahead, most companies do not intend to take further pricing actions. Most mgmt sounded hopeful on gradual demand improvement in upcoming qtrs,
1QFY26 result notes - JUBI: Unapologetic Focus on Growth
Eternal: Neighbour's Envy - Owner's Pride
HUL: Better Days Ahead
GCPL: Margin Pressure but Positive Outlook Stays
Marico: Industry Leading Volume Growth
VMM: Strong Growth Momentum with Margin Expansion
APNT: Growth over Margins?
VBL: Weak Volumes but more than offset by Margins
ITC: Strong Cigarette Volume Growth but...
Nestle: A miss in 1QFY26 results
BRIT: A Miss in 1QFY26 Results
TCPL: Broadly inline outcome
Exhibit 1-Sector demand trends

Sector1QFY26FY26Key CompaniesFood deliveryModerateModerateJubilant Foodworks, Devyan, Sapphire Foods, Westlife Foodworks, Barcor, NutritionModerateModerateZomato, SwiggyApparel &amp; footwearWeakModeratePage Industries, VMart, Vedant Fashions, ABFRL, Shoppers Stop, Go Colors, Nykaa, Metro Brands, Bata, CampusModerateModerateAsian Paints, Birla Opus, Berger Paints, Kansai Norelac, PidiliteJewelryModerateModerateTitan, KalyanModerateModerateD Mart, Relance Retail, Vishal Mega MartStaplesModerateModerateHUL, Nestle, Britannia, ITC, GCPL, Dabur, Marico, Colgate, TCPL, VBL
aided by improving macro factors like lower inflation, above avg. monsoon forecast, tax cuts, good agri. output and favourable govt. policies.

Consumption demand continued to remain soft due to macro factors while competitive intensity remained high. In Pizza, Domino's reported strong near- double- digit SSS. Pizza Hut, which had positive SSSG in \(4Q(+1\%)\) , again turned in negative and was weak with - 4 to - 8% SSS in 1Q. Growth was led by transactions/orders for both brands as the focus remained high on value offerings. Delivery continued to grow faster than the dine- in channel for both pizza brands. KFC witnessed improvement in performance sequentially. Food delivery platforms (Zomato, Swiggy) witnessed growth rate similar to 4Q, but were still healthy at \(16 - 19\%\) YoY (GOV), given the weak consumption demand. Margins were adversely impacted by operating deleverage in 1Q and higher costs. Companies are hopeful of an improvement in the demand situation in coming quarters on the back of tax cuts and easing of inflation.
Exhibit 2 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

CompaniesCommentary on demand QSR and food delivery platformsJubilant FoodworksIn 1Q, JUBI reported near-D/D SSSG. Delivery continued its strong run with c25% YoY growth (despite impact of free delivery coming in the base) which stayed much ahead of the platforms like Zomato &amp; Swiggy. Dine-in growth improved QoQ to +2.5% YoY (20%+ ex-takeaway), and mgmt expects the segment to see further improvement going forward. Mgmt feels that the food aggregators are complementary to their own assets and will continue to actively collaborate with them. Mgmt expects the drag on profitability from other brands (Dunkin', Hong's, Popeyes) will halve over the next couple of years, and hence will aid in improving the margin profile. Mgmt focus continues to remain on driving growth.Devyani InternationalWeak performance in 1Q as SSS declined across key brands KFC (-0.7%) and Pizza Hut (-4.2%) despite a low base. Management noted that in KFC, online (via food delivery platforms) SSSG was positive. Mgmt expects to see positive SSSG in KFC over the next few qtrs. Focus on Pizza hut scale is expected to go down. Near-term macro factors have led to soft consumer demand, but mgmt. expects the SSSG to come back once consumption starts to pick up. On the acquisition portfolio, the initial focus will be to turn the brand contribution positive in the next 12 months, after which it will work towards ramping it.Sapphire FoodsFor KFC, SSSG remained flat however, transaction growth (SSSTG) has turned LSD positive. Pizza Hut SSSG slipped back to negative territory at -8% in 1Q. Sri Lanka did well with DD growth in SSSG (+12% LKR) and SSTG. There is a DD difference in SSSG between Tamil Nadu performance and the rest of the market in Pizza Hut; Tamil Nadu delivered LSD positive SSSG.Restaurant Brands Asia (India business)SSSG came in at 2.6%, declining sequentially. The demand environment has been tighter than usual, with the premium end seeing low demand; however, lower-end demand continues to be strong. Mgmt. expects 3Q to see improvements in demand with positive tailwinds in the premium segment. Company is focusing on driving footfalls in its stores and improving profitability of the delivery business.Westlife FoodworldSSSG came in at +0.5% YoY, led by order volume primarily due to higher value offerings. The demand environment continues to be soft; however, the company expects eating out to pick up gradually in FY26, supported by lower inflation and government stimulus. Mgmt highlighted slower traction in South versus West.Barbeque NationIndia SSSG came in at -5.2%, impacted by a softer dine-in cycle. However, the delivery segment (15% salience) continues to see positive SSSG. The South India market is dragging the growth, as the company is seeing stress in outlets that are heavily dependent on IT businesses. July has not seen any improvement in performance and continues to be similar to 1Q. Removal of 5% service charge has led to a negative impact of -0.5% on gross margin and overall sales realization. Mgmt. maintained its store network target of 300-325 restaurants by FY27.ZomatoFood GOV grew 16% YoY, but increased restaurant-funded discounts drove 13% growth in NOV. Food delivery FY26 growth is likely to stay lower than the guidance of 20%, but over 15%. Q/c has been a headwind to food delivery growth, but in the long term, food delivery shall continue to grow at 20%. Mgmt didn't mention any impact from GLP-1 drugs on FP consumption and mentioned it is too early to judge the potential impacts. Blinkit is moving fully to a 1P model over the next three quarters. This will raise working capital by 18 days, but mgmt. sees no concern given the 100bps margin boost and &gt;40% ROCE potential. This should weigh on Hyperpure revenues, which will decline, given the business acted as a back end for Blinkit.Swiggy1Q growth in food delivery was strong while momentum continued in Q/C, with smart AOV expansion. However, EBITDA margins came-off in both (QoQ) which mgmt attributed to factors like higher payouts to riders, revision in staff comp, etc. Mgmt mentioned that food delivery growth remains strong and margins should normalise over the year. Q/C contribution loss should reduce (break-even in 2-4 qtrs) but decline in adj. EBITDA loss may be more gradual due to competition. Mgmt is not averse to a shift to 1P where margins could be up to 70bps higher.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Overall, the industry's demand environment remained subdued in 1Q as well. However, management expects the demand environment to improve in FY26 due to a good monsoon, lower inflation and higher disposable income. Most apparel companies highlighted a subdued demand environment in 1Q, which impacted performance. Vedant Fashion highlighted an overall subdued spending pattern, but saw some recovery in wedding- related spends. Page Industries witnessed a sequential slowdown in growth. ABFRL's ethnic business performed well due to higher wedding dates; however, Pantaloons saw muted performance due to shift in Eid timings. Trent reported sequential moderation in growth to multi- quarter low levels (+20% YoY); Westside and Zudio witnessed sequential moderation in growth on account of base expansion, subdued demand and pickup in competition. GoColours reported modest growth with early signs of recovery. Shoppers Stop witnessed premium products growing ahead of overall business and reported positive customer entry growth after many years, though value fashion lagged; however, beauty witnessed growth on back of fragrances and premiumisation. Beauty growth was strong for Nykaa, led by strong growth in transacting users (due to customer acquisitions).
Exhibit 3 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

CompanyCommentary on demandApparel &amp; BPCTrentStandalone revenue grew 20% YoY, a multi-quarter low. Zudio and Westside both witnessed sequential growth moderation on account of base expansion, subdued demand, and pick-up in competition, in our view. Fashion portfolio LFL growth slowed to LSD in 1Q versus MSD in 4QFY25 and DD in 1H1FY25. Zudio store additions moderated significantly in 1Q with 1 net new store (total store count 766). Westside added 0 net new stores (total count to 248). However, both formats reported an area addition of 0.1mn each, implying stores opened were of larger size than the ones closed.Page IndustriesRetail environment continued to remain subdued in 1Q due to festive timing shifts, geopolitical tensions and retail slowdown, volume growth came in at 2% YoY. Mgmt. highlighted that it does not intent to take price hikes in near term. Mgmt expects DD growth when the market conditions normalize and also focuses on strategic investments including SAP migrations, new manufacturing facilities and product innovations. As per mgmt. long term outlook is strong for the company.ABFRLThe industry continues to face subdued demand environment, however, the pace of recovery continues to be gradual. Ethnic business did well due to higher wedding dates. Pantaloons saw muted perf. due to the shift in Eid timings. Mgmt. remains confident on strong SSS growth across most formats, except Pantaloons. Focus remains on accelerating expansion across some formats (Tasva, StyleUp, designer brands), while improving profitability across others (Pantaloons, TCNS).ABLBLABLBL sales grew by 5% YoY amid sluggish discretionary demand environment, weak consumer sentiment and geopolitical uncertainties. Discounting was reduced and Double Digit SSSG was achieved across the branded portfolio. The Company added 50+ gross stores and is on track to add 250+ new stores during FY26Vedant FashionIn 1QFY26, the company continued to face muted discretionary consumption trends, particularly in the mid and premium discretionary categories as overall spending patterns were subdued. Company, however, saw some recovery in wedding-related spending. SSSG grew by 18% YoY; AP and Telangana have seen a sharp rebound in 1Q.Go ColorsDuring 1QFY26, company has achieved a low single digit SSSG of 2.0% as the broader environment remains challenging and temporary supply chain disruptions from Bangladesh route. There are some early signs of gradual improvement in demand and mgmt is hopeful for the later part of the quarter during End of Season Sale. Mgmt also remains confident on SSSG coming back to low-single digits in the coming qtrsShoppers StopMgmt noted that the market showed mixed trends with sporadic impact on consumer discretionary. Premiumization trend remained resilient with premium products growing ahead and the company reported positive customer entry growth after several years. Customer entry in April was flat, but the progress in May and June was good. ATV has been increasing consistently with 6% growth in 1Q. Beauty registered a 2% growth on the back of fragrances and premiumization. INTUNE faced a tough 1Q due to high discounting and overall slowness in value fashion segment.NykaaConsol. revenue growth was strong at +23% YoY, despite a relatively high base. Beauty GMV growth (incl. eB2B), remained strong at 25% YoY, led by a strong growth in transacting users. Fashion GMV picked up sequentially to 25% YoY; the NSV growth was slower implying higher discounting. Mgmt sounded positive on its house of brands strategy, with Dot & Key GMV at Rs15bn. In beauty, the company is benefiting from investment in customer acquisitions made in previous qtrs. In fashion, the focus is on building brands through its own marketplace, while the inventory-led model remains largely restricted to own-labels.HonasaGrowth slowed down sequentially to 7% YoY - this was due to unseasonal rains which impacted its summer portfolio (sunscreen). Mgmt. noted c200bps impact on revenue due to seasonality issue. Interestingly, UVG was higher at 10.5% - the gap was partially due to change in channel mix. The growth was led by younger brands, which grew 20% YoY even while Mamaearth portfolio continued to see an improvement. Mgmt expects Mamaearth brand to return to growth by end-FY26. Mgmt. guided for a D/D revenue growth for the remaining qtrs of FY26.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Overall demand conditions for footwear continued to remain sluggish in 1Q. Bata continues to work on driving affordability and reducing complexity across categories. Metro Brands mentioned that 1Q growth was impacted by the early monsoon; however, it highlighted that demand in AP/Telangana has seen green shoots. Campus mentioned that competitive pressures from China continue to ease, but it witnessed volume decline in 1Q due to lower sales of school footwear (entry level/DIP) in the distribution channel and muted demand in online channels. Companies continue to work on initiatives to boost growth such as improving product mix, distribution expansion, increasing online sales, etc. Mgmt remain hopeful of demand recovery going ahead.
Exhibit 4 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

CompanyCommentary on demandFootwearMetro BrandsMarket demand was influenced by early monsoons which dampened shopping calendar shifts affecting sales timing. 1QFY26 grew 9% YoY despite headwinds from early monsoons and offset of Eid season. Demand in AP/Telangana has seen some green shoots. Mgmt. reiterated commitment to 15%+ revenue CAGR in the medium-to-long term. Company has not implemented any extraordinary or one-off price hikesBata1QFY26 has also witnessed a muted demand environment. The company continued its efforts to driving affordability and reducing complexity across categories. It has undertaken initiatives to improve stock turns and forecast accuracy for optimal inventory and greater agilityCampusDemand continues to remain sluggish in 1Q. Company witnessed 12% YoY volume decline in 1Q, the impact was offset by higher ASP and higher margin product mix. Volume decline was driven by muted demand in online channel and lower sales of entry level (DIP) school shoes, slippers and sandals in distribution channel. Competitive pressure from China continued to ease. Mgmt remains hopeful of demand recovery going ahead
Source: Company data, Jefferies

In 1QFY26, the paints and adhesives sector experienced mixed demand trends. Asian Paints reported subdued overall demand due to weak macroeconomic conditions and early monsoons, with urban areas showing some improvement in April- May before rains impacted June; rural demand remained stable. Birla Opus showed strong sequential growth and continued to gain market share (now over \(10\%\) market share combined with Birla White). Berger reported modest volume growth, led by urban demand and strong perf in construction chemicals. Kansai Nerolac saw flat volumes amid competition and regional disruptions but expects better H2. Pidilite delivered over \(10\%\) growth, driven by strong rural and small- town demand, and remains optimistic about sustaining double- digit growth. Overall, companies expect demand to improve in Q2 with festive tailwinds.
Exhibit 5 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

CompanyCommentary on demandPaints and AdhesivesAsian PaintsOverall demand conditions remained subdued due to weak macro and early monsoon but saw a sequential uptick led by marginal improvement in urban in Apr-May, however, Jun was impacted by rains while rural was stable. North, West and East regions did well while South was weak. Product mix remained weak esp. luxury emulsions. Demand in July so far, has been similar to 1Q but 2Q should benefit due to early festive demand. Mgmt expects value-volume growth to be in single digits in the coming qtrs.Birla OpusBirla Opus grew DD on QoQ basis. Mgmt noted that while the organized decorative paints industry has grown by over 5% on a YoY basis, ex-Birla Opus revenues, the industry has degrown slightly or remained flatish. Despite current market challenges driven by incumbent players pushing low-end economy products, company expects the the industry to return to DD growth. Birla Opus is now the #3 decorative brand, and combined Birla White putty business, it has crossed 10% revenue market share, on exit run-rate basis.Berger PaintsDecorative business reported 5.6% volume growth and 2% value growth in 1QFY26, with the Decorative segment delivering mid-single-digit volume growth. Construction chemicals and waterproofing delivered robust volume-value growth with stable margins. Urban markets demonstrated early momentum and outperformed other regions, driven by improving consumer sentiment and selective product category strength. While easing inflation and and supportive policy environment may support rural sentiment. Demand should come back once the rain is stopped and the mgmt expects growth close to the 9-10% rangeKansai NerolacDecorative paint segment continues to face intense competition. May was impacted by early onset of monsoon and to Indo-Pak conflict in North, where Nerolac has a strong presence. Rural demand remained stable, while urban demand showed slight improvement. Decorative paint volumes for 1Q were broadly flat. In automotive segment, demand for 2W and PV is expected to remain stable to subdued. On the other hand, the tractor segment is likely to perform well, driven by favorable monsoon conditions and increased agricultural activity. Overall, mgmt is hopeful that Q2 will be better than Q1 and anticipates that the 2HFY26 to be stronger than 1H.PidilitePidilite reported a standalone revenue growth of 10.6% in Q1 FY26, driven by a robust UVG of 9.9%. Rural and small-town markets continued to outpace urban areas, a trend seen over the past few quarters. state-wise performance is improving QoQ, Looking ahead, the company is confident of maintaining or even surpassing DD UVG, supported by a broad-based product portfolio, sustained innovation and an expected pick-up in overall demand sentiment.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Sales growth was healthy in 1Q despite the sharp rise in gold prices. The demand environment remained tough, with weak consumption due to high gold prices and elevated competitive intensity. Titan mentioned that many customers preferred products with low making charges, even at high ticket sizes. Q2 is expected to see a higher base effect due to the previous year's customs duty and deferment of demand from 1Q to 2Q. Companies expect demand conditions to improve in the coming quarters on the back of a strong wedding season, government spending, and improvement in liquidity.
Exhibit 6 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

CompanyCommentary on demandJewelleryTitanDemand environment remained tough with weak consumption due to high gold prices and elevated competitive intensity. Customers preferred products with low making charges, even at high ticket sizes. CaratLane launched 9 carat jewellery last year and has seen good customer acceptance. Q2 FY26 is expected to see a higher base effect due to the previous year's customs duty cut and deferment of demand from Q1 to Q2 last year. However, Q2 had a good start due to festival of diamonds which helps in studied activations. Margin guidance for jewellery remains at 11-11.5% for FY26. LGD market is quite small at &lt;2% of the studied diamond market (which is valued at around R570bn, per mgmt est). Mgmt continues to evaluate the LGD space but does not seem to be convinced to take a plunge yet.Kalyan JewellersConsol revenue growth of 31% with strong demand momentum continuing from previous qtr and robust performance during key festive. SSSG in south was 20% while non-south was at 16%. Current quarter started off well despite the volatility in gold prices with July demand remaining strong. Management highlighted continued shift in inventory composition to adapt to changing consumer preferences, and is targeting a PBT margin above 5%.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Multi- category retailers witnessed a decent performance in 1Q with HSD+ topline growth across most companies. V- Mart highlighted that retail growth remained strong in T2/T3 cities, with T1 markets also seeing momentum. Reliance Retail delivered decent core revenue growth of 8% YoY. DMart's revenue growth slowed down QoQ to \(\sim 16\%\) YoY with moderation in LFL sales and a weaker mix as FMCG share rose. Vishal Mega Mart reported a strong SSSG of \(11.4\%\) , in spite of a shift in festivals to 4Q, the company is expanding in under- penetrated states. V- Mart's 1Q perf. was impacted by Indo- Pak conflict and early onset of monsoon.
Exhibit 7 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings call

CompanyCommentary on demandMulti-category retailReliance RetailCore revenues grew ~8% YoY. Core rev/sqft grew 12% YoY but declined QoQ (-10%) partially due to seasonality. Offline grocery performed well, driven by general merchandise and value apparel as highlighted in management commentary. Fashion &amp; lifestyle reported steady growth driven by new store formats (GAP, Azorte, Youta) and own brands, with emerging formats registering +60% YoY growth. Jiomart's quick-commerce scaled rapidly with 175% YoY growth in average daily orders. Retail area expanded with 388 new store openings during the quarter, taking total store count to 19,592 stores (77.6 mn sq ft), marking a return to growth after strategic store rationalization in prior quarters.D-MartRevenue growth declined sequentially to 16.3% YoY. LFL revenue growth moderated to 7.1% YoY in 1QFY26. Store additions accelerated to 9 net new stores in 1QFY26 bringing the total store count to 424 as of 1QFY26. The company experienced mix deterioration, with the share of high-margin general merchandise and apparel falling to approximately 24.7% of revenue, while the FMCG segment's contribution increased. DMart Ready demonstrated strong performance in key metros, driven by a rising salience of home delivery. Management expressed confidence in the scalability of DMart Ready but reiterated that profitability remains a long-term objective.Vishal Mega MartVMM's reported 1QFY26 adjusted SSG stood at 11.4%, achieved despite the absence of Eid and Ugadi festivals which were shifted to 4QFY25. Management continues to prioritize growth over margin expansion, with plans to reinvest any incremental margin gains back into the business while maintaining current profitability levels. The company has expanded into under-indexed geographies including Gujarat and Maharashtra, having opened new stores in Naroda (Ahmedabad) and Anand (Gujarat) during the quarter, with early performance described as "encouraging" by management. South India expansion continues with additions in Karnataka and other states.V-Mart RetailV-Mart Retail's 1QFY26 was impacted by the Indo-Pak conflict in select areas of North India and early onset of monsoon in June, which slightly affected performance. Growth was largely driven by continued increase in footfall and aided by very good wedding season. Total apparel ASPs grew by 1% with 2% growth in V-Mart and a conscious 3% decline in Unlimited due to ongoing shift towards more value-led offerings. Management guided for 12-15% net area addition annually with around 65 new stores targeted this year, focusing on continued expansion. Industry retail growth momentum continues with strong traction in Tier 2/3 cities alongside Tier 1 markets.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

In 1Q, most companies highlighted a gradual improvement in urban demand while rural continued to outgrow urban. Companies with exposure to summer categories such as beverages, cooling hair oil/prickly heat powder, sunscreen and ice cream were impacted due to unseasonal rains. Vol. growth improved sequentially, while realisation growth continued to persist as the industry resorted to product price hikes to pass on the input cost inflation. However, going ahead, most companies do not intend to take further pricing actions. Most mgmt sounded hopeful on gradual demand improvement in upcoming qtrs, aided by improving macro factors and favourable govt. policies.
Exhibit 8 - Key management commentary from 1QFY26 earnings calls

Cos.Commentary on demandCommentary on marginHULHUL's consol. vol. grew 4% YoY. Overall demand environment has seen a gradual improvement aided by lower inflation, above average monsoon forecasts, etc. Urban has started to pickup, but rural continued to outgrow. HUL expects H1FY26 growth to be better than 2H1FY25, aided by portfolio transformation and improving macro. Focus will be on driving volume-led growth.GM contracted &gt;220bps YoY due to input cost inflation, with 120bps EBITDA margin contraction. GM is expected to improve QoQ, by reducing pricing &gt; cost gap and improving mix. HUL will reinvest savings to drive growth and guidance stays at 22-23% EBITDA margin, around 1ppt lower than the past. Tea prices were reset inline with the input cost deflation, in order to stay competitive even while consumption cost was higher than spot.ITCCig volumes grew +6% in 1Q, with early signs of urban demand recovery in 1Q. Expectation of a normal monsoon and better trends in hair growth could also be positive for rural demand. Lower inflation, tax cuts, interest rates reduction is expected to aid in growth. HMCG grew 5% YoY, due to continued pressure in notebooks portfolio (ex-notebooks, FMCG grew 5% YoY) because of high competition and lower realizations. Paperboards continue to see muted perf. due to impact of subdued realizations, influx of low-priced supplies in India and surge in domestic wood prices.Margin contracted across segments. Commodity prices continued to remain inflated across several key inputs (viz. edible oil, wheat, maize, cocoa etc.) during 1Q. Consumption of high cost leaf tobacco &gt; other inputs, largely mitigated through improved mix and strategic cost management &gt; calibrated pricing.NestléDomestic volume + mix growth improved sequentially to c.3% YoY in 1Q. Three out of its four product categories performed well, per mgmt. with DD growth in beverages and confectionary, mainly price-led, in our view.GM contracted 250bps YoY to 55%, due to elevated commodity prices. Opex were also high due to mgf. expansion over the past few qtrs. Ebitda, remained flat YoY. Coffee prices are expected to remain range-bound while cocoa and edible oil have stabilized. Milk prices may line with a favorable monsoon and flush season.BritanniaMgmt highlighted an uptick in FMCG demand across both urban and rural markets and witnessed DD growth in rural and HSD growth in urban markets. Britannia's overall market share was flattish, but the company has outpaced peers, per mgmt. Some market share was lost in the East to local competition, due to execution issues because of an ongoing distribution restructuring.GM contracted &lt;260bps YoY to 39.2% due to continued cost inflation, esp. in palm oil (+45% YoY) and wheat flour (+8% YoY), despite a sequential moderation. Other inputs (sugar, cocoa &gt; laminates) also saw YoY pressure. The company does not intend to take any further pricing actions. Palm oil duty cuts partly benefited 1Q, with more impact expected in 2Q. Mgmt expects input costs to stabilize going aheadGCPLMgmt highlighted better consumption in 1Q vs 4Q. The company expects the perf. to improve gradually through FY26, with H2 better than H1. Vol. grew 5% YoY, despite a sharp decline in soaps due to grammage cuts and unseasonal rains, however pack growth in soaps was in DD. HI grew HSD volumes, with market share gains in electrical as well as at the entire category level, a first in a decade. Indonesia had a weak performance in 1Q with flat volumes YoY, while value (c/c) declined by 4% due to macro issues.India EBITDA margin declined &gt;3ppt YoY due to &gt;5ppt decline in GMs due to severe pressures in soaps - high-cost inventory of palm oil. Mgmt. noted margin pressure in soaps shall continue in 2Q as well and the benefit of lower palm oil should be visible in 2H. The company also took some product price cuts in HI and hair colour portfolio, which too had slight impact on margins. Standalone Ebitda margins in 1H will be below the normative range, but H2 should see some improvements.DaburSeasonal portfolio (glucose &gt; beverages) declined in DD impacted by rains, which impacted overall performance - ex of this, revenues grew 7% YoY. Urban markets witnessed QoQ recovery, but rural demand continued to outgrow urban. Mgmt expects sequential demand recovery on the back of improving macro, tax cuts, softening food inflation, and a positive monsoon forecast. Mgmt. expects a DD top-line growth in the coming qtrs. also aided by a low base. The company guided for single-digit top-line growth for FY26 with improving Ebitda margins.GM contracted by c75bps YoY, despite taking 3-4% product price hikes. However, Ebitda margin (excl. legal costs) was flat YoY (in-line) due to lower A&gt;P (-14% YoY). Mgmt expects inflation to be around 8% going ahead, but expects to mitigate its impact via product price hikes along with cost savings.Tata ConsumerRevenue grew 10% with UVG of c7%. Packaged beverages reported price-led (in tea) revenue growth of 12% YoY with 1% vol growth. NourishCo reported 13% YoY revenue decline due to unseasonal weather and ongoing competition. Foods revenue growth (organic) came in strong at 16%, with volumes up 6% while reported growth (incl M&A) was 14% YoY. Sales business grew 13% on back of mid-single-digit vol. growth. Unbranded business performance was heavily impacted due to moderating coffee prices. Guidance of MSD volume growth in tea and salt continues.EBITDA margin contracted 270bps YoY, due to significant cost inflation in tea, resulting in EBITDA decline of 8% YoY. Unbranded business Ebitda margins contracted by 7ppt. International EBITDA margins contracted ~270bps due to lower GM and higher opex. Mgmt. expects tea prices to soften going forward led by better tea crop YoY, which would aid margins.MaricoIndia value/volume growth was at a 16-qtr high. Volume growth at 9% is impressive and was despite decline in Parachute. International c/c growth was also strong. Marico witnessed stable to improving demand trends across urban and rural, with premium outperforming mass segment. The company expects a gradual recovery in demand aided by easing inflation, favourable monsoon, and govt. policy support.GM contracted &gt;5 ppt YoY due to high input cost inflation (copa &gt; vegetable oil), which was partially offset by price hikes. This along with higher A&gt;P (+25% YoY) led to EBITDA margin contraction (~350bps YoY). Copa remained inflated in 1Q (100%+ YoY), while edible oil prices saw moderation. Mgmt does not intend to take further product price hikes in Parachute, as copra prices are expected to cool off going ahead.ColgateMgmt. highlighted that the performance was affected by subdued urban demand and continued heightened competitive intensity in the industry. Mgmt. also attributed some of the impact to a high base in previous years. The premiumisation trend continued, led by the new launches, in our view. Mgmt. is expecting a gradual recovery in 2H1FY26.Gross margins contracted &gt;175bps YoY/QoQ, to 68.6%. Ad-spends declined by 5% YoY in absolute terms, but remained broadly similar as a percentage of revenues (-14bps YoY). EBITDA margin contracted &gt;2.4ppts YoY/QoQ, to 31.6%, due to GM contraction and negative operating leverage, which was also lower than our estimate.VBLIndia was impacted by the rains, which led to a volume decline of c.7% YoY - one of the worst in many qtrs. Unit realisation was also down c.2%, due to higher salience of water and small packs performing better than larger packs. Int’l revenues grew &gt;20% YoY, with c.15% volumes. South Africa volumes grew 16% YoY. VBL is actively looking for expansion (incl M&A) in international markets.Consol. GMs remained flat YoY to 54.5%, aided by balanced product mix and cost improvements. Despite a decline in volumes, Ebitda margins improved by &gt;80bps YoY to 28.5% (higher than JFE), due to cost controls in India and strong margin expansion in international business. Mgmt. expects cost control benefits to continue to flow and expects India margins to sustain, despite increased competition.EmamiUn-seasonal rains and short summer impacted Emami's summer portfolio, as a result overall 1Q volumes declined by 3%. 1Q continued to witness pressure on urban discretionary consumption, while rural demand showed signs of recovery. Mgmt. expects the macro environment to gradually improve aided by lower inflation and above-average monsoon.GM expanded by 170bps to 69.4% led by benign input costs and product price hikes. However, Ebitda margins remained flat YoY due to higher opex. Mgmt has guided that A&gt;P spends as a % of sales in FY26 will be similar to FY25. Mgmt also expects stable input costs in the near future.
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
